description: Creates and manages a Object in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Storage Classic container. `storage_endpoint` must be set in the provider or environment to manage these resources.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Container.description: The name of Storage Container the store the object in.

Content.description: Raw content in string-form of the data.

ContentDisposition.description: Set the HTTP `Content-Disposition` header to specify the override behaviour for the browser, e.g. `inline` or `attachment`.

ContentEncoding.description: set the HTTP `Content-Encoding` for the object.

ContentType.description: set the MIME type for the object.

CopyFrom.description: name of an existing object used to create the new object as a copy. The value is in form `container/object`. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the container and object.

DeleteAt.description: The date and time in UNIX Epoch time stamp format when the system removes the object.

Etag.description: MD5 checksum value of the request body. Strongly Recommended.

File.description: File path for the content to use for data.

Metadata.description: Additional object metadata headers. See [Object Metadata ](#object-metadata) below for more information.

Name.description: The name of the Storage Object.

TransferEncoding.description: Set to `chunked` to enable chunked transfer encoding.
